result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon C. Werner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs, drug buy money and DNA surcharge within 60 days (5/13/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant must maintain full time employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

(1:11) (14CF354 & 15CF368) Defendant Johnathon C. Werner in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn Shelton and def is eligible for SPD services in both.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video; Parties heard on def's FTA for trial in 14CF354 & review hearing in 15CF368; Court orders $5000 cash w/previous conditions of bond reinstated; prelim is set in 15CF368; matter to be set in Br 3 for 14CF354;

Attorney Steven John Luchsinger appeared by phone means for Defendant Johnathon C. Werner. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Luchsinger heard, has no new information on Def.  Atty Klomberg heard, Def. was scheduled to appear in Br. 4 earlier this morning - notes indicate that Def. did not appear nor did he apply for SPD, and a warrant was issued in that case. This case was left on to see if Def. appeared and if a trial needed to be kept on calendar. All parties agree that the trial may be cancelled for next week. Court heard, so ordered - trial is cancelled.
Status conference at 01-06-2016 11:00 am

Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger appeared. DA Klomberg appears for State. Defendant FTA. Atty Luchsinger doesn't believe appearance of defendant necessary. DA Klomberg heard; notice given and sites local rule. Discussion held. DA Klomberg points out on bond states defendant must appear for ALL hearings. Court heard and forfeits bond and issues WA; leaves JT on at this time. DA Klomberg questions how long leaving JT. Discussion held. Court leaves JT on until In Person Status in January. Motions in Limine for State: Court orders 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, as granted.  Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Def.'s attorney withdrew on the 23rd; Def. states he needs to go to SPD; State unaware that atty. withdrew and thought had agreement; discussion held; RH 7/1/15 at 8:15am; Def. starting new job next week; Def. go go directly to SPD from Court; TSC set; bond cont.

9:14 - Defendant Johnathon C. Werner in court with attorney Clifford A. Arthur.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. New address: W10785 Hwy 49, Waupun 53963. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
